class.name: JTableHeader
class.comment: --Redrawing the header is slow in cell selection mode. --Since header selection is ugly and it is always clear from the --view which columns are selected, don't redraw the header.
*** should also implement AccessibleSelection? *** and what's up with keyboard navigation/manipulation?
class.javadoc:
This is the object which manages the header of the JTable.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeansTM has been added to the java.beans package. Please see {@link java.beans.XMLEncoder}. Alan Chung Philip Milne javax.swing.JTable

@see #getUIClassID
#readObject
The table for which this object is the header; the default is null.
The TableColumnModel of the table header.
If true, reordering of columns are allowed by the user; the default is true.
If true, resizing of columns are allowed by the user; the default is true.
Obsolete as of Java 2 platform v1.3. Real time repaints, in response to column dragging or resizing, are now unconditional.
The index of the column being resized. null if not resizing.
The index of the column being dragged. null if not dragging.
The distance from its original position the column has been dragged.
The default renderer to be used when a TableColumn does not define a headerRenderer.
Constructs a JTableHeader with a default TableColumnModel. #createDefaultColumnModel

Constructs a JTableHeader which is initialized with cm as the column model. If cm is null this method will initialize the table header with a default TableColumnModel. cm the column model for the table #createDefaultColumnModel

method.name: JTableHeader
method.comment: setFocusable(false); // for strict win/mac compatibility mode,
this method should be invoked
Initialize local ivars
Get UI going

class.javadoc:
Sets the table associated with this header.
table the new table
bound: true description: The table associated with this header.

Returns the table associated with this header.
the table property

Sets whether the user can drag column headers to reorder columns.
reorderingAllowed true if the table view should allow reordering; otherwise false
#getReorderingAllowed
bound: true description: Whether the user can drag column headers to reorder columns.

Returns true if the user is allowed to rearrange columns by dragging their headers, false otherwise. The default is true. You can rearrange columns programmatically regardless of this setting.
the reorderingAllowed property
#setReorderingAllowed

Sets whether the user can resize columns by dragging between headers.
resizingAllowed true if table view should allow resizing
#getResizingAllowed
bound: true description: Whether the user can resize columns by dragging between headers.

Returns true if the user is allowed to resize columns by dragging between their headers, false otherwise. The default is true. You can resize columns programmatically regardless of this setting.
the resizingAllowed property
#setResizingAllowed
Returns the the dragged column, if and only if, a drag is in process, otherwise returns null. the dragged column, if a drag is in process, otherwise returns null #getDraggedDistance

Returns the column's horizontal distance from its original position, if and only if, a drag is in process. Otherwise, the the return value is meaningless.
the column's horizontal distance from its original position, if a drag is in process, otherwise the return value is meaningless
#getDraggedColumn
Returns the resizing column. If no column is being resized this method returns null. the resizing column, if a resize is in process, otherwise returns null
Obsolete as of Java 2 platform v1.3. Real time repaints, in response to column dragging or resizing, are now unconditional.

method.name: setUpdateTableInRealTime

class.javadoc: Obsolete as of Java 2 platform v1.3. Real time repaints, in response to column dragging or resizing, are now unconditional.

method.name: getUpdateTableInRealTime

class.javadoc: Sets the default renderer to be used when no headerRenderer is defined by a TableColumn. defaultRenderer the default renderer 1.3
Returns the default renderer used when no headerRenderer is defined by a TableColumn. the default renderer 1.3
Returns the index of the column that point lies in, or -1 if it lies out of bounds. the index of the column that point lies in, or -1 if it lies out of bounds

Returns the rectangle containing the header tile at column. When the column parameter is out of bounds this method uses the same conventions as the JTable method getCellRect. the rectangle containing the header tile at column JTable#getCellRect

method.name: getHeaderRect
method.comment: x = width = 0;

class.javadoc:
Allows the renderer's tips to be used if there is text set.
event the location of the event identifies the proper renderer and, therefore, the proper tip
the tool tip for this component

method.name: getToolTipText
method.comment: Locate the renderer under the event location
Now have to see if the component is a JComponent before getting the tip
Convert the event to the renderer's coordinate system
No tip from the renderer get our own tip

the TableHeaderUI object that renders this component

Sets the look and feel (L&F) object that renders this component.
ui the TableHeaderUI L&F object

Notification from the UIManager that the look and feel (L&F) has changed. Replaces the current UI object with the latest version from the UIManager. JComponent#updateUI

the string "TableHeaderUI"
"TableHeaderUI"

Sets the column model for this table to newModel and registers for listener notifications from the new column model. columnModel the new data source for this table IllegalArgumentExceptionif newModel is null #getColumnModel bound: true description: The object governing the way columns appear in the view.
Returns the TableColumnModel that contains all column information of this table header. the columnModel property #setColumnModel

Invoked when a column is added to the table column model.

Application code will not use these methods explicitly, they are used internally by JTable. e the event received TableColumnModelListener

Invoked when a column is removed from the table column model.

Application code will not use these methods explicitly, they are used internally by JTable. e the event received TableColumnModelListener

Invoked when a column is repositioned.

Application code will not use these methods explicitly, they are used internally by JTable. e the event received TableColumnModelListener

Invoked when a column is moved due to a margin change.

Application code will not use these methods explicitly, they are used internally by JTable. e the event received TableColumnModelListener

Invoked when the selection model of the TableColumnModel is changed. This method currently has no effect (the header is not redrawn).

Application code will not use these methods explicitly, they are used internally by JTable. e the event received TableColumnModelListener
Returns the default column model object which is a DefaultTableColumnModel. A subclass can override this method to return a different column model object the default column model object
Returns a default renderer to be used when no header renderer is defined by a TableColumn. the default table column renderer 1.3
Initializes the local variables and properties with default values. Used by the constructor methods.

method.name: initializeLocalVars
method.comment: I'm registered to do tool tips so we can draw tips for the renderers

class.javadoc: Sizes the header and marks it as needing display. Equivalent to revalidate followed by repaint.

Sets the header's draggedColumn to aColumn.

Application code will not use this method explicitly, it is used internally by the column dragging mechanism. aColumn the column being dragged, or null if no column is being dragged
Sets the header's draggedDistance to distance. distance the distance dragged

Sets the header's resizingColumn to aColumn.

Application code will not use this method explicitly, it is used internally by the column sizing mechanism. aColumn the column being resized, or null if no column is being resized
See readObject and writeObject in JComponent for more information about serialization in Swing.

Returns a string representation of this JTableHeader. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

Overriding paramString to provide information about the specific new aspects of the JFC components. a string representation of this JTableHeader

Gets the AccessibleContext associated with this JTableHeader. For JTableHeaders, the AccessibleContext takes the form of an AccessibleJTableHeader. A new AccessibleJTableHeader instance is created if necessary.
an AccessibleJTableHeader that serves as the AccessibleContext of this JTableHeader

class.name: AccessibleJTableHeader
class.comment: If this flag is true, then the header will repaint the table as a column is dragged or resized; the default is true.
class.javadoc:
This class implements accessibility support for the JTableHeader class. It provides an implementation of the Java Accessibility API appropriate to table header user-interface elements.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeansTM has been added to the java.beans package. Please see {@link java.beans.XMLEncoder}.

Get the role of this object.
an instance of AccessibleRole describing the role of the object
AccessibleRole

Returns the Accessible child, if one exists, contained at the local coordinate Point.
p The point defining the top-left corner of the Accessible, given in the coordinate space of the object's parent.
the Accessible, if it exists, at the specified location; else null

method.name: getAccessibleAt
method.comment: Locate the renderer under the Point

class.javadoc:
Returns the number of accessible children in the object. If all of the children of this object implement Accessible, than this method should return the number of children of this object.
the number of accessible children in the object.

Return the nth Accessible child of the object.
i zero-based index of child
the nth Accessible child of the object
